page.title: 13SHOPPING
page.content: Apperley has one shop which sells everyday produce. For clothes and groceries the villagers shop in Tewkesbury (5 miles) or Gloucester (12 miles) where national chain stores can be found. Better quality shops can be found in Cheltenham, 10 miles away. As well as selling food the shop is also a Post Office. Buses, operated by the private bus company, 'Swanbrooks' of Cheltenham, run nearly every hour from eight o'clock to six thirty but in winter the buses run later as snow and floods can hinder a normal route. Many people own cars and go to Gloucester to do their shopping where there is a big supermarket called 'Asda'. This new superstore also provides a free Saturday bus service from Tewkesbury.
